text: Tephritis hyoscyami is a species of fly in the family Tephritidae , the gall flies. It is found in the Palearctic.Fauna EuropaeaBei-Bienko, G.Y. & Steyskal, G.C. (1988) Keys to the Insects of the European Part of the USSR, Volume V: Diptera and Siphonaptera, Parts I, II. Amerind Publishing Co., New Delhi. Séguy, E. (1934) Diptères: Brachycères. II. Muscidae acalypterae, Scatophagidae. Paris: Éditions Faune de France 28 Bibliotheque Virtuelle Numerique pdf The larvae feed on Carduus crispus, Carduus nutans, and Cirsium species. ==References== Category:Tephritinae Category:Insects described in 1758 Category:Muscomorph flies of Europe Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Tephritis hyoscyami
